docs.text: Welcome to Mahendra Pawar Agents Documentation Welcome to the official documentation for the AI-workbench . This project provides a collection of AI agents designed to handle various tasks, from simple stateless queries to complex planning and summarization. Repository Link Click Here Core Features Stateless Agent : A lightweight agent for one-shot request/response interactions. Ideal for quick queries and code generation. Summarizer Agent : An advanced agent capable of planning and executing tasks, specifically designed for summarizing content and file operations with async support. Extensible Architecture : Built on a modular provider interface, allowing easy integration with different LLM backends. Navigation Getting Started : Learn how to install and set up the project. Stateless Agent Guide : Detailed instructions on using the Stateless Agent. Summarizer Agent Guide : Comprehensive guide for the Summarizer Agent. API Reference : Technical documentation for developers.

docs.text: Getting Started This guide will help you get up and running with the AI-workbench . Prerequisites Python 3.8 or higher pip (Python package installer) Access to a supported LLM provider (e.g., Gemini, OpenAI) - Check src/config/settings.py for configuration details. Installation Clone the repository: bash git clone <repository-url> cd AI-workbench Create and activate a virtual environment (optional but recommended): bash python -m venv .venv source .venv/bin/activate # On Windows: .venv\Scripts\activate Install dependencies: bash pip install -r requirements.txt Environment Configuration: Create a .env file in the root directory and add your API keys. env # Example .env GOOGLE_API_KEY=your_api_key_here Basic Usage Running the Stateless Agent The stateless agent is perfect for quick, single-turn interactions. python src/run_stateless_agent.py Running the Summarizer Agent The summarizer agent is designed for more complex tasks requiring planning and valid file operations. python src/run_summarize_agent.py

docs.text: Stateless Agent Guide The Stateless Agent is the simplest agent in the workbench. It is designed to handle direct, one-off user requests without maintaining conversational history or complex state. How it Works The agent takes a user's input, wraps it in a predefined prompt template ( AGENT_PROMPT ), and sends it to the configured LLM provider. The response is then returned directly to the user. Key Features Fast & Lightweight : No overhead for state management or complex planning. Direct : ideal for "Ask and Answer" scenarios. Code Generation : Optimized for generating python code snippets or answering technical questions. Usage Example To use the stateless agent, run the provided CLI script: python3 src/run_stateless_agent.py The agent will start an interactive session where you can enter your requests: Stateless AI Agent (Multi-Provider) ---------------------------------- You: Write a Python function to calculate the Fibonacci sequence. Agent: [Agent generates response here] You: exit Type exit or quit to terminate the session.

docs.text: Summarizer Agent Guide The Summarizer Agent is a more sophisticated agent capable of planning and executing multi-step tasks. It is specifically designed to handle long content summarization and file writing operations. Architecture The agent operates in two main phases: Planning Phase : The Planner component analyzes the user request and breaks it down into a list of structured steps (e.g., "summarize text", "write to file"). Execution Phase : The agent iterates through the plan and executes each step using the appropriate tool. Available Tools The Summarizer Agent has access to specific tools: text_summarizer : Summarizes long text content using the LLM. file_write : Writes content to a specific file path. Usage Example To use the summarizer agent, run the provided CLI script: python3 src/run_summarize_agent.py The agent will start an interactive session where you can enter requests: Summarizer Automation Agent (v2) -------------------------------- You: Summarize the README.md file and save it to summary.txt [Agent plans and executes the task] Agent completed successfully. --- SUMMARY --- [Generated summary appears here] You: exit [!NOTE] The Summarizer Agent runs asynchronously and automatically plans multi-step workflows based on your request.
